perturbation.original_text: 5.2.1 Invoicing and Payment. Operator shall invoice Owner, monthly, for all costs and expenses incurred hereunder during the immediately preceding month and, without duplication, in any prior month. Owner shall pay all such amounts prior to the later of (a) 50 days after the end of the month in which the expenses were incurred or (b) 10 days after the date of receipt of each invoice. Invoices received after 1:00 pm local time will be deemed received on the next Business Day. If the day on which any payment is due is not a Business Day, then the relevant payment shall be due upon the immediately succeeding Business Day. Any amounts which remain due and owing after the due date shall bear interest at the lower of the prime rate as published in the "Money Rates" section of The Wall Street Journal plus two percent (2%) per annum and the maximum lawful rate of interest, compounded daily from the date such payment is due until such payment is made. Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, any indemnification payments required to be made by a Party hereunder shall be made to the indemnified Party upon receipt by the indemnifying Party of written demand therefor from the indemnified Party.

perturbation.explanation: The modification changes the payment deadline for indemnification payments. The original text states they are to be paid 'upon receipt' of written demand, which is ambiguous. The modified text specifies a strict 5-business-day deadline, creating a contradiction with the 'upon receipt' clause. This creates uncertainty because, under the new clause, the indemnified party may expect payment within 5 days but will be hard to impose this if the party that should pay argue for the 'upon receipt' deadline.

perturbation.original_text: 3.3 Operator Default. Owner may terminate this Agreement at any time upon the occurrence of any of the following: (a) the dissolution or bankruptcy of Operator; If any of the above occurs and Owner elects to terminate this Agreement, then Owner may give a written notice of termination to Operator, which termination shall be effective on the date specified by Owner in the notice, provided that such termination date shall be within 60 days of the date the notice is delivered to Operator. Owner's notice of breach to Operator under Section 3.3(c) or (d) shall state with particularity the breach alleged by Owner. To the extent Operator disputes the basis for Owner's notice of breach, then the matter shall be addressed under Section 9.6. Nothing in this Section 3.3 shall be construed to limit or preclude any remedy Owner may have at law or in equity with respect to any material breach by Operator. 3.4 Cooperation with Owner or Successor Operator.

perturbation.explanation: The modification adds a clause that allows Owner to terminate the contract 'at any time without a prior notice period' if the Operator's performance falls below a certain industry standard. This contradicts the earlier part of Section 3.3, which requires a written notice of termination and a 60-day period for the termination to take effect. The conflict creates uncertainty because it's unclear under what circumstances the Owner can bypass the notice period and immediately terminate the agreement, leading to legal disputes.

perturbation.original_text: 5.2.2 Disputes. If a good faith dispute arises as to the amount payable under any invoice issued by Operator, Owner shall pay the amount not in dispute on or before the due date, and if Owner elects to withhold any portion of a payment which otherwise would be due if not for such dispute, Owner shall provide Operator a written notice of such dispute on or before the date such payment is due setting forth, in reasonable detail, its reasons for withholding the disputed amount. If it is subsequently determined, whether by mutual agreement of the Parties or otherwise, that Owner is required to pay all or any portion of the disputed and withheld amounts, then in addition to paying such amounts, Owner shall pay interest accrued on such amounts (including amounts withheld) at the default interest rate described in Section 5.2.1 from the original due date until paid in full. 5.3 Setoff.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.2.2 Disputes. If a good faith dispute arises as to the amount payable under any invoice issued by Operator, Owner shall pay the amount not in dispute on or before the due date, and if Owner elects to withhold any portion of a payment which otherwise would be due if not for such dispute, Owner shall provide Operator a written notice of such dispute within 30 days of the invoice date, setting forth, in reasonable detail, its reasons for withholding the disputed amount. If Owner fails to provide this notice within the stipulated 30-day period, Owner forfeits the right to dispute the invoice and the total amount becomes immediately due. If it is subsequently determined, whether by mutual agreement of the Parties or otherwise, that Owner is required to pay all or any portion of the disputed and withheld amounts, then in addition to paying such amounts, Owner shall pay interest accrued on such amounts (including amounts withheld) at the default interest rate described in Section 5.2.1 from the original due date until paid in full. 5.3 Setoff.
perturbation.explanation: The modification alters the deadline for notifying the Operator of a payment dispute. The original clause requires a notice 'on or before the date such payment is due'. The altered text introduces a strict 30-day notice period tied to the invoice date and threatens forfeiture of dispute rights if the deadline isn't met. This creates a conflict, as the owner might reasonably assume the notice can be given until the payment due date according to the general standard, leading to disputes about the validity of withheld payments and creating ambiguity about when the amounts are actually due. The 30 day clause acts as a strict condition, while the original text is tied to the payment terms.
